If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.

co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: enhance the separation rate of the photogenerated electrons and holes.Also the positions of conduction band (CB) and valence band (VB) changed with improving the amount of TiO 2 in the as-prepared photocatalysts.The photocatalytic activities of as-prepared photocatalysts were investigated by photoreduction of CO 2 , the results exhibit that the composite photocatalysts clearly improve the photoreduction of CO 2 to CH 4 and CO.The highest yields of CH 4 and CO are of 72.2 and 56.2 mol g A 1 at an optimized

CO is from CO 2 reduction with the as-prepared photocatalysts.Compared with the pure C 3 N 4 photocatalyst, the composite C 3 N 4 TiO 2 on reduction of CO 2 is clearly enhanced, the reason can be attributed to the hetterjunctions between C 3 N 4 and TiO 2 , which could improve the charges transfer, the separation rate of photogenerated electrons and holes is effectively promoted and the photocatalytic reduction is further enhanced.According to our work, we further summarize some works about metal oxide

as-synthesized photocatalysts were performed on a FEI Tenai G2 F30 S-Twin.X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was examined by an Escalab 250Xi photo-electron spectrometer using Al K radiation.The optical properties were measured by UV-vis diffuse reflectance (DRS) spectroscopy (UV-2450 Shimazu Japan) and the BaSO 4 as the reference.Photoluminescence (PL) spectroscopy was carried out on a photoluminescence detector (F4500, Hitachi Japan). The CO 2 photoreduction was performed using a closed photochemical

light energy excited on C 3 N 4 TiO 2 composite photocatalyst, the electrons can directly act on CO 2 under light irradiation and further form CO 2 -species; Meanwhile, the holes could act to H 2 O and further generate H .At this time the species of species could further act on the H with different electrons and form the CO and CH 4 656667.

some works about metal oxide coupling with g-C 3 N 4 for photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 , the results show in Table 2.It can be clearly found that the products with different reaction system are also variant.Although the irradiation condition same, the different catalysts and reaction system could generate the different products.The most reasons mainly attribute to the reaction system, even the reactor.Therefore, the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 is really complex processes, especially the reaction

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: using a closed photochemical reactor with a volume of 300 mL at 0.4 MPa pressure and room temperature.0.1 g photocatalyst, 100 mL NaOH (0.1 M) solution and a certain amount of triethanolamine (TEOA) were added into the photochemical reactor.Subsequently, it was bubbled by CO 2 gas for 30 min to remove the impurities gases.Turn off air inlet and air outlet until the inner pressure was 0.4 MPa.The 8 W UV-light lamp was used as the light source.After every 1 h, the gas products were detected by the gas

as-synthesized photocatalysts were performed on a FEI Tenai G2 F30 S-Twin.X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was examined by an Escalab 250Xi photo-electron spectrometer using Al K radiation.The optical properties were measured by UV-vis diffuse reflectance (DRS) spectroscopy (UV-2450 Shimazu Japan) and the BaSO 4 as the reference.Photoluminescence (PL) spectroscopy was carried out on a photoluminescence detector (F4500, Hitachi Japan). The CO 2 photoreduction was performed using a closed photochemical

especially the reaction conditions have small changes, the results could change a lots.In our work, the irradiation condition is under UV lamp, clearly the power is small and it can analyze two products in the reduction processes, the yields of CH 4 and CO are not too low.Indicating that this reaction system may be used to further investigate for the reduction of CO 2 . According to our experimental results, the charges transfer pathways of the composite photocatalyst can be figured out in Fig. 9.As

56.2 mol g A 1 at an optimized modified amounts of TiO 2 under 4 h irradiation of 8 W UV lamp, respectively.The strategy of TiO 2 modified C 3 N 4 could successfully obtain effective photocatalyst for CO 2 conversion.

light energy excited on C 3 N 4 TiO 2 composite photocatalyst, the electrons can directly act on CO 2 under light irradiation and further form CO 2 -species; Meanwhile, the holes could act to H 2 O and further generate H .At this time the species of species could further act on the H with different electrons and form the CO and CH 4 656667.

photocatalysts of TiO 2 C 3 N 4 with different ratios were obtained. The X-ray diffraction (XRD) patterns of as-synthesized samples were carried out on XRD-diffractometer Bruker AXS D8 (Germany).The morphologies of as-synthesized samples were detected on field emission scanning electron microscopy (FE-SEM, 7800F Japan).The size and nanostructure were examined on transmission electron microscopy (TEM, JEOL JEM-2100).High-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM) of as-synthesized photocatalysts
